comments:
Drive: TPTP-4.2.0-200605151131 

Steps:

1. Create a new plugin in your workbench named "logAnalyzerTest" which imports "org.eclipse.hyades.analysis.engine". Specify the type as "org.eclipse.hyades.models.cbe.CBEDefaultEvent" or "org.eclipse.hyades.models.cbe.CBECommonBaseEvent". 
2. Create an empty implementation of the interface org.eclipse.hyades.analysis.engine.ILogAnalyzer named LogAnalyzerTest
3.  Now run the workbench containing the new plugin and create a "Log Analyzer sample"  from the menu File->New->Example->Hyades Logging->Apache Log Correlation/Analyzer Sample.
4. Verify that the Apache error log provided  by the sample was analyzed and in the log view on the Analysis Results tab the following result is displayed 

"File does not exist
File does not exist:
Try reinstalling the apache server.
Contact your local administrator."

Results:

The example wizard dialog does not close itself due to the following exceptions.

Alex, can you please look at this.

The test cases works fine to me with driver:
eclipse-SDK-3.2RC3-win32.zip
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.2.0RC3.zip
tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.2.0-200605170918.zip

In step 1, there are steps missed.

It should be:

1. Create a new plugin in your workbench named "logAnalyzerTest". The plugin imports "org.eclipse.hyades.analysis.engine" as a dependency. 
Create an extension "org.eclipse.hyades.analysis.engine.logAnalyzer"
Specify the type of extension point as "org.eclipse.hyades.models.cbe.CBEDefaultEvent" or
"org.eclipse.hyades.models.cbe.CBECommonBaseEvent".
Specify Class to what is created in step 2.

An example would be:
<extension
         point="org.eclipse.hyades.analysis.engine.logAnalyzer">
      <logAnalyzer
            class="loganalyzertest.LogAnalyzerTest"
            id="loganalyzertest.LogAnalyzerTest"
            name="loganalyzertest.LogAnalyzerTest"
            type="org.eclipse.hyades.models.cbe.CBEDefaultEvent"/>
</extension>

Jack. Please update the testcase if they are not correct.

Jack I cannot seem to reproduce your problem with the following driver:
http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/drops/TPTP-4.2.0-200605170100.html.
I asked also Eugene to test to make sure I am not wrong.
Please reopen the bug if you can still reproduce it and explain how you were able to get to that exception.
